titlepage.titleproper: Choices and Challenges Forum Records, ca. 1985-2003
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections RG 15/27/1

defitem.label: Processed by: Caroline Harvey and Laurel Rozema,

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Choices and Challenges Forum Records, ca. 1985-2003
did.abstract: The Choices and Challenges Forum Records, RG 15/27/1, contain correspondence, meeting notes, articles, plays, advertisements, grant applications and reports, and more from the development of the first 22 Choices and Challenges fora, from 1985 to 2003. The Choices and Challenges Forum at Virginia Tech was founded in 1985 by Doris Zallen, who served as its director until 2003. Each forum addresses the ethical and social issues created by advances in science, technology, and medicine.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Choices and Challenges Forum Records must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Choices and Challenges Forum Records, RG 15/27/1, Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Choices and Challenges Forum Records was transferred to Special Collections in July 2017.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the Choices and Challenges Forum Records was completed in October 2018, based upon the arrangement and description created by Dr. Doris Zallen, the first director of the Choices and Challenges Forum.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Choices and Challenges Forum at Virginia Tech was founded in 1985 by Doris Zallen, who served as its director until 2003. Each forum addresses the ethical and social issues created by advances in science, technology, and medicine. The fora also examine the historical, philosophical, societal, and legal components.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Choices and Challenges Forum Records, RG 15/27/1, contain correspondence, meeting notes, articles, plays, advertisements, grant applications and reports, and more from the development of the first 22 Choices and Challenges fora, from 1985 to 2003.

The records are divided into five series, subdivided by forum: I. Doris Zallen, director files, ca. 1985-2003; II. Photographs, 1985-2003; III. Videocassette Tapes, 1985-2002; IV. Audiocassette Tapes, 1985-1989; and V. Posters, 1985-2003.

In the first series, Doris Zallen, director files, ca. 1985-2003, each forum files contains folders devoted to forum planning (with notes or items from the planning process), pre-forum publicity, correspondence related to planning and publicity, and items related to the awarding of continuing-education credits to doctors or other professionals. Additional material pertains to speakers and session leaders, such as CVs and correspondence, and to post-forum activities, including articles and evaluations. Some fora include materials related to teleconferencing, outreach, lessons plans, and other activities.
The second series, Photographs, 1985-2003, document forums 1-19 and 21-22.
The third series, Videocassette Tapes, 1985-2002, contains videocassettes from local tv programs, and the different panels at forums 1, 6, 8, 9-19, and 21.
The fourth series, Audiocassette Tapes, 1985-1989, consists of audiocassettes of the different panels from forums 1, 2, 4, 5, 7, and 12.

The fifth series, Posters, 1985-2003, has forum posters as well as a poster about the project, The Choices and Challenges Project - exploring the social and ethical dimensions of science and technology, from in between the 20th and 21st fora.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Choices and Challenges Forum Records are organized into the following series:
Series I. Doris Zallen, director files, ca. 1985-2003

did.unittitle: Problem with University Distinguished Professors' Forums

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The UDPs started a forum series and picked a subject (Climate Change) that the Choices and Challenges project had already selected and for which funding was awarded by the Virginia Foundation for the Humanities (VFH). This created the need to suddenly change the topic to "Pesticide Dilemma" and threatened funding from the VFH. The Presidential Symposia lasted only for a few years.
